sub_title: engagement, socio-technical innovation, transition & impact, climate justice
summary:
I consider myself as a transdisciplinary human, skilled at uncovering and realising creative opportunities in diverse fields of study, enabling me to cross boundaries and link communities. At TU Delft’s Faculty of Architecture, alongside city stakeholders, international sustainability experts and young innovators I define spatial solutions capable of influencing policy, actions vital for the future wellbeing of people and their cities in an era of climate emergency and justice. Complimenting those city ambitions at TU Delft, I hold the position of ‘Professor of Architecture’ at the Grenfell-Baines Institute of Architecture in the United Kingdom.

My doctoral thesis, the first to be awarded at the Manchester School of Architecture, proposed a spatially creative design method for the sustainable growth of cities. Expertise evolving to meet societal urban challenges and climate justice through a first of a kind participatory live lab that I lead across Europe. My aim is to bridge together the culturally creative and technical industries for the advancement of cities, public space and societal value. A key accelerator for the energy transition ensuring that city aspirations for the environment are amplified and nurtured by the families who will live them.

For all publications, articles, media & activities see 'Pure':
https://research.tudelft.nl/en/persons/cl-martin

treasury_media.title: Urban Dialogues: The Just City (1st edition)
treasury_media.description:
A series of webinars organized by Tecnológico de Monterrey in cooperation with Springer Nature, that brings together students, professors, researchers, government, businesses and NGO’s to discuss urgent urban topics.
The first webinar focussing on vulnerable communities and social justice in the city and how to respond to this in urban planning and design.

treasury_media.title: Let’s recalibrate our educational attitudes (TU Delft - Under the spotlight Series)
treasury_media.description:
Let’s recalibrate our educational attitudes:
Designing education for meaningful engagement with society.
(Teaching Academy Key Speaker Invitation)

In this under the spotlight, Craig Martin will discuss the challenges and benefits involved in recalibrating an educational design studio to better engage students with communities. He will describe his latest project in the Buitenhof neighbourhood of Delft that took place in September 2022.

treasury_media.title: Future Islands - Sustainable Dutch Caribbean
treasury_media.description: Platform Future Islands organised a first Webinar with keynotes of Craig Lee Martin from TU Delft and Joost Meijs form Aruba Airport Authority N.V. Please read here a first recap.

treasury_media.title: IBTV DOC: Roadshow Lucifer, Angel & The PacMan
treasury_media.description: De Indische Buurt Klimaatneutraal in 2030: hoe gaan we dat samen doen? IBTV maakte een filmverslag van de Roadshow Indische Buurtklimaatneutraal. Maar het project gaat door! Wat kunnen we bijvoorbeeld nu al gaan doen in de Javastraat? Hieronder een...

treasury_media.title: KaDEr interviews Peter Drenth (Deputy Leader, Province of Gelderland) en Craig Martin (Roadshow Leader) - 2 Films
treasury_media.description:
The expert roadshow would be invited to The Gelderland in September 2021 to support a process of energy transition in the monumental cities of Elburg and Zutphen. Two cities best known for their cultural heritage and monumental buildings, whose city landscapes and histories present significant challenges in response to future climate change and resilience. 
See link:
https://www.erfgoedalliantie.nl/kader/videos+living+labs/default.aspx

treasury_media.title: An interview conversation between Peter Drenth (Deputy Leader, Province of Gelderland) and Prof.Dr. Craig Martin (Leader of the Roadshows)
treasury_media.description: The roadshow would be invited to The Gelderland in September 2021 to support a process of energy transition in the monumental cities of Elburg and Zutphen. To begin an interview conversation between Peter Drenth (Deputy Leader, Province of Gelderland) and Craig Martin (Leader of the Roadshow Team) took place in the first roadshow of Elburg that focussed on how to build trust within communities in order to help co-create that sustainable city vision.

treasury_media.title: Hoe maak je Elburg en Zutphen klimaatneutraal? Team van wetenschappers komt met ideeën
treasury_media.description: Een team van internationale wetenschappers was afgelopen week in Elburg om daar te zoeken naar creatieve manieren om de gemeente klimaatneutraal te maken. Het grote aantal monumenten in de historische vesting maakt het erg lastig om goede maatregelen...

treasury_media.title: Roadshows Energie in Elburg en Zutphen groot succes - Erfgoed Alliantie
treasury_media.description:
Begin september vonden in Elburg en Zutphen de Roadshows energietransitie plaats. De roadshows werden geleid door professor Dr. Craig Martin; Architectural Engineering&Technology TU Delft en professor Dr. Ir. Andy van den Dobbelsteen; Climate Design & Sustainability TU Delft.

Daarbij gebruik makend van de aanwezige potentie van de stad. De resultaten zijn weergegeven in een uitgebreide presentatie. Die vindt u hier. Dagblad De Stentor plaatste een uitgebreid artikel over de Roadshow in Elburg.

treasury_media.title: Ideeën TU Delft: Van waterkrachtturbines in de IJssel tot groentekassen in Leesten
treasury_media.description: ZUTPHEN - Hoe werk je aan een leefbare, duurzame stad? De ‘roadshow’ van de Technische Universiteit in Delft deed onder meer al Belfast, Nicosia en Amersfoort aan. Vorige week waren ze met een internationaal gezelschap in Zutphen.

treasury_media.title: Warmte opslaan in de stadsgracht? Wetenschappers TU Delft denken na over een klimaatneutraal Elburg
treasury_media.description: Hoe kan Elburg klimaatneutraal worden? Op die vraag geeft een team van wetenschappers de komende drie dagen antwoord. In de monumentale vesting gaan ze al pratend, tekenend en rekenend op zoek naar de mogelijkheden. ,,Maar belangrijker nog is dat...

awards.title: Solar Decathlon World competition
awards.description: Solar Decathlon World competition, Versailles, Paris. TU Delft’s ‘Home-with-a-Skin’, designed and constructed in response to family need, received five awards in total, including winning outright the ‘Sustainability Contest’ and ‘Communication & Social Awareness’ award. Post-competition receiving national acclaim by being selected as ‘exemplar’ by the Dutch Government in its ‘Energie Sprong’ (Energy Leap) future energy and city solution initiative.

awards.title: The City of Dubrovnik Contribution Award
awards.description: The City of Dubrovnik Contribution Award. Following the City-zen Roadshow in Dubrovnik, on the instruction of Mayor Andro Vlahušić and City of Dubrovnik Development Agency (DURA), Craig was officially recognised for his outstanding contributions to the sustainable development of the City.
